text: the suffragettes were militant and

would shock the world and radically
change democracy in Britain in the
representation of the People Act of 1918
it wasn't just some women who won the

were working-class men were

working-class women still couldn't do

used extreme methods to promote their

fact there is a poll in 1913 Emily
Davison died after running into the path

they persevered in spite of all danger
and discouragement because they knew
their cause was right there have been

to be pardoned but no mention of it in
this speak the truth of their arguments
won the day and we are all in their debt
in this parlor at the home of Emmeline
Pankhurst the suffragettes came up with
the motto deeds not words a sentiment
that still resonates and I think
violence remains a huge issue for women
it was an issue that suffragettes
campaigned about they weren't ever of
just interested in the vote and actually
it's still a huge issue for women I
think being a person of color and then
being a woman you have two layers it's

you have to kind of negotiate and pick

the suffragettes started with voting
